front.title: IP Tunnels in the Internet Architecture

abstract.t: This document discusses the role of IP tunnels in the Internet architecture. An IP tunnel transits IP datagrams as payloads in non- link layer protocols. This document explains the relationship of IP tunnels to existing protocol layers and the challenges in supporting IP tunneling, based on the equivalence of tunnels to links. The implications of this document updates RFC 4459 and its MTU and fragmentation recommendations for IP tunnels.
